name: anim
description: The Animation Utility allows properties to animate the transition between values.
author: msweeney

examples.name: basic
examples.description: Creating and using a simple animation.

examples.name: easing
examples.description: The Animation Utility allows you to implement 'easing effects' — for example, when an animation gradually slows down as it nears completion, that's an easing effect known as 'ease-in'.  This example shows you how to use easing effects with your animations.

examples.name: colors
examples.description: Color animations can be effective indicators of state during the lifespan of a dynamic page.  This example shows you how to animate color attributes of an element.

examples.name: alt-iterations
examples.description: The direction attribute can be used to reverse the animation on alternate iterations.

examples.name: anim-xy
examples.description: This example shows you how to animate the xy coordinates of an element.

examples.name: curve
examples.description: This example demonstrates animating an element along a curved path using bezier control points.

examples.name: reverse
examples.description: The reverse attribute allows you to change the run direction of an animation.

examples.name: end-event
examples.description: This example demonstrates how to use the end event.
